AOE01-d-05-03-98-SFS.Narrative: EMPLOYEE RIDES POINT UNTIL THE THIRD CAR IS HALF ON THE MAIN BEYOND SWITCH AT NORTH END OF S5.  EMPLOYEE DOES NOT HEAR ANY UNUSUAL SOUNDS WHICH MIGHT INDICATE THAT A SWITCH HAS BEEN SPLIT.  THE CREW IS CONCERNED AT THIS POINT WITH THE POSITIONING OF THE TRAIN FOR PICKING OFF A CAR SO THAT RE-COUPLING WILL NOT BE A PROBLEM.  EMPLOYEE DOES NOT NOTICE THAT THE SWITCH IS LINED WITH THE RUN-AROUND.  HESETS THE HAND BRAKE AND THEN THE CREW UNCOUPLES THE CAR NEXT TO THE ENGINE AND IT IS PLACED IN S3.THE ENGINE RETURNS TO THE FOUR CARS NOW SITTING ON THE MAIN.  EMPLOYEE ATTEMPTS TO RELEASE THE HANDBRAKE AND IT STICKS.  ANOTHER EMPLOYEE ASSISTS AND THEY ARE ABLE TO RELEASE THE HAND BRAKE.  EMPLOYEE TELLS THE AMTRAK ENGINEER TO MOVE FORWARD AND ALMOST IMMEDIATELY THE TWO  EMPLOYEES NOTICED THATTHE CAR, SAN ANTONIO, IS MOVING DOWN THE MAIN AT THE FRONT AND THE S5 AT THE REAR.  ONE OF THE EMPLOYEES CALLED AMTRAK #7 AND THE ENGINEER STOPS IMMEDIATELY.  TWO CARS WERE DERAILED.  30. O = RADIO.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
